abstracts.cdata!:
The main objectives of the project are
            to support the formulation and implementation of
            Nigeria's national gas policy and development, to
            assist in preparation of the first major infrastructure
            project in the gas sector, and to help strengthen the
            country's institutional capacity to develop gas
            resources.  These objectives would be achieved by providing:
            (a) engineering design, procurement assistance, review of
            detailed engineering by contractors, and initial
            construction supervision for the Escravos-Lagos pipeline
            (ELP) project; (b) assistance in establishment of
            NNPC's Gas Unit, including training, organization, and
            management and operating assistance for the ELP system; (c)
            engineering services for future gas supply expansion in the
            western delta area, for feasibility studies for recovering
            natural gas liquids from flared gas and gas streams, and
            other gas and liquified petroleum gas (LPG) engineering
            studies; (d) marketing, pricing and tariff studies for gas
            and LPG; and (e) assistance to NNPC for corporate planning,
            information systems, capital budgeting and project evaluation.
